titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Laurence Vail Coleman Letter, 1927
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists of a letter to Coleman from zoologist, Roy Chapman Andrews, leader of the Central Asiatic Expeditions of the American Museum of Natural History. Andrews, in China, wrote about the destruction of Chinese antiquities, the "robber generals," and the embargo on the exportation of museum specimens.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Laurence Vail Coleman letter, 1927, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Director of American Association of Museums; member of executive committee of International Museums Office in Paris.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of a letter to Coleman from zoologist, Roy Chapman Andrews, leader of the Central Asiatic Expeditions of the American Museum of Natural History. Andrews, in China, wrote about the destruction of Chinese antiquities, the "robber generals," and the embargo on the exportation of museum specimens.
